challenge.title: Concatenating Strings with Plus Operator
challenge.description:
In JavaScript, when the + operator is used with a String value, it is called the concatenation operator. You can build a new string out of other strings by concatenating them together.

Example

'My name is Alan,' + ' I concatenate.'

Note: Watch out for spaces. Concatenation does not add spaces between concatenated strings, so you'll need to add them yourself.

Example:

const ourStr = "I come first. " + "I come second.";

The string I come first. I come second. would be displayed in the console.
challenge.instructions: Build myStr from the strings This is the start. and This is the end. using the + operator. Be sure to include a space between the two strings.

tests.text: myStr should have a single space character between the two strings.
myStr should have a value of the string This is the start. This is the end.
tests.testString: assert(myStr === 'This is the start. This is the end.');

tests.text: You should use the + operator to build myStr.
myStr should be created using the const keyword.
You should assign the result to the myStr variable.

challengeFiles.name: script
script
